definitions.definition: One side's (from when the first player begins to bat, until the last player is out) or individual player's turn to bat or the runs scored during those durations.
The time during which any party is in possession of power, or enjoying good luck, etc.; a turn of any kind.
A person's lifespan.

A period of play in which members of a visiting baseball team attempt to hit a baseball pitched by the opposing home team until three players are called out, followed by a similar attempt by members of the home baseball team against the visiting team's pitching. There are nine or more innings in a regulation baseball game.
definitions.example: It is a baseball tradition to sing "Take Me Out To the Ball Game" during the seventh inning stretch.

definitions.definition: A similar period of play.
definitions.example: We batted around in our half of the inning.

definitions.definition: A player (or team)'s turn at the table to make shots until ended by a miss or a foul.
A chance or opportunity to perform some deed or act.
definitions.example: We are in just the second inning of our quest to enter this new market.

definitions.definition: The gathering of a crop; harvesting.
Lands recovered from the sea.
A natural water stream that flows into a larger river or other body of water.
A nation, state, or other entity that pays tribute.
Related to the paying of tribute.
Subordinate; inferior
Yielding supplies of any kind; serving to form or make up, a greater object of the same kind, as a part, branch, etc.; contributing.
definitions.example: The Ohio has many tributary streams, and is itself tributary to the Mississippi.

definitions.definition: To deliver (an audio programme) over the internet on a regular basis.
The distribution of multimedia files over the Internet for playback on a mobile device, often in MP3 format.
A scholar of ecology.
A person who rescues someone or something.
A device that controls the flow of a gas or fluid through a pipe.
A device that admits fuel and air into the cylinder of an internal combustion engine, or one that allows combustion gases to exit.
One or more membranous partitions, flaps, or folds, which permit the passage of the contents of a vessel or cavity in one direction, but stop or control the flow in the opposite direction
definitions.example: the ileocolic, mitral, and semilunar valves

definitions.definition: One of the leaves of a folding-door, or a window-sash.
A vacuum tube.
One of the pieces into which certain fruits naturally separate when they dehisce.
A small portion of certain anthers, which opens like a trapdoor to allow the pollen to escape, such as in the barberry.
One of the pieces or divisions of bivalve or multivalve shells.
One of the two similar portions of the shell of a diatom.
To control (flow) by means of a valve.
A person who makes one or more purchases.
definitions.example: Every person who steps through the door is a potential buyer, so acknowledge their presence.

definitions.definition: (retailing) A person who purchases items for resale in a retail establishment.
definitions.example: The supermarket's new buyer decided to stock a larger range of vegetarian foods.

definitions.definition: A person who purchases items consumed or used as components in the manufacture of products.
A multi-residence housing facility intended for the elderly.

A ruminant, of the genus Giraffa, of the African savannah with long legs and highly elongated neck, which make it the tallest living animal; yellow fur patterned with dark spots, often in the form of a network; and two or more short, skin-covered horns, so-called; strictly speaking the horn-like projections are ossicones.
A giraffe unicycle.
A laugh.
definitions.example: Are you having a giraffe?!

definitions.definition: The dry, leafy or stringy exterior of certain vegetables or fruits, which must be removed before eating the meat inside
definitions.example: A coconut has a very thick husk.

definitions.definition: Any form of useless, dried-up, and subsequently worthless exterior of something
definitions.example: His attorney was a dried-up husk of a man.

definitions.definition: The supporting frame of a run of millstones.
To remove husks from.
An infection in cattle caused by a species of Dictyocaulus or lungworm
To cough, clear one's throat.
To say huskily, to utter in a husky voice.
An explosion (physical or emotional).
definitions.example: I heard Jen's blow-up from the next room.

definitions.definition: An enlargement (e.g. of a photograph).
definitions.example: Make a blow-up of the chart so we have more room to draw on it.

definitions.definition: Inflatable; able to be blown up.
definitions.example: The kids played with a blow-up sea-monster in the pool.

definitions.definition: To prove to be false or erroneous; to confute; to refute.
A person with red hair.
A North American duck (Aythya americana) highly esteemed as a game bird.
A kind of milkweed (Asclepia curassavica), with red flowers, formerly used in medicine.
Chinese red-headed centipede
Red-headed bunting (Emberiza bruniceps)
Red-headed titi (Callicebus regulus)
Red-headed vulture (Sarcogyps calvus)
Red-headed woodpecker (Melanerpes erythrocephalus)
The act of depriving, dispossessing, or bereaving; the act of deposing or divesting of some dignity.
The state of being deprived
The taking away from a clergyman of his benefice, or other spiritual promotion or dignity.
(followed by “of”) lack
definitions.example: He was suffering from deprivation of sleep.

definitions.definition: A chasm or fissure.
definitions.example: My marriage is in trouble: the fight created a rift between us and we can't reconnect.

definitions.definition: A break in the clouds, fog, mist etc., which allows light through.
A shallow place in a stream; a ford.
To form a rift; to split open.
To cleave; to rive; to split.
definitions.example: to rift an oak

definitions.definition: (obsolete outside Scotland and northern Britain) To belch.
A privately-owned minibus or van hired to carry passengers.
The therapeutic practice of encouraging better quality of life through the pursuit of work or other occupations.
(ironical) busy work
A trifle; an insubstantial thing.
A short piece of literature or of instrumental music, typically light or playful in character.
A game similar to billiards played on an oblong table with pockets or arches at one end only.
Any of several smaller, wooden table top games developed from the original bagatelle in which the pockets are made of pins; also called pin bagatelle, hit-a-pin bagatelle, jaw ball.
To meander or move around, in a manner similar to the ball in the game of bagatelle.
To bagatellize; to regard as a bagatelle.
A board, somewhat like a broad ski, or a very long skateboard with no wheels, used in the sport of snowboarding.
To ride a snowboard.
A hot relish made from chili peppers and other ingredients.
An attempt to solve a problem using the power of human imagination.
Resembling a peach, peach-like.
definitions.example: Although this is an apricot pie, it tastes peachy.

definitions.definition: Very good, excellent.
definitions.example: Life is peachy now that summer has come.

definitions.definition: A small stall for the display and sale of goods.
An enclosure just big enough to accommodate one standing person.
An enclosed table with seats, as in a diner or café.
An enclosure for keeping animals.
Given to showers; having frequent rainfall.
Of or relating to a shower or showers.
Someone or something that feels.
definitions.example: Are you more of a feeler or more of a thinker?

definitions.definition: An antenna or appendage used for feeling, especially on an insect.
Something ventured to test another's feelings, opinion, or position.
definitions.example: I sent out some feelers but they didn't seem interested.

definitions.definition: An act of interchanging.
A highway junction in which traffic may change from one road to another without crossing a stream of traffic.
A connection between two or more lines, services or modes of transport; a station at which such a connection can be made.
definitions.example: Holborn tube station is the only interchange between the London Underground Central and Piccadilly Lines

definitions.definition: To switch (each of two things)
definitions.example: to interchange places

definitions.definition: To mutually give and receive (something); to exchange
To swap or change places
To alternate; to intermingle or vary
definitions.example: to interchange cares with pleasures

definitions.definition: To act as or carry out an interchange (noun, senses 2, 3).
The act of comparing prices of something in advance before shopping for the best bargain
Someone who devises strategies.
The state of being brothers or a brother.
An association for any purpose, such as a society of monks; a fraternity.
The whole body of persons engaged in the same business, especially those of the same profession
definitions.example: the legal brotherhood

definitions.definition: People, or (poetically) things, of the same kind.
Discarded or waste material; rubbish, trash.
A collection of miscellaneous items of little value.
Any narcotic drug, especially heroin.
The genitalia.
Salt beef.
Pieces of old cable or cordage, used for making gaskets, mats, swabs, etc., and when picked to pieces, forming oakum for filling the seams of ships.
A fragment of any solid substance; a thick piece; a chunk.
Material or resources of a kind lacking commercial value.
definitions.example: junk fish; junk trees

definitions.definition: To throw away.
To find something for very little money (meaning derived from the term junk shop)
definitions.example: (On Facebook, a record collector wrote:) "The newest addition to my Annette Hanshaw collection, I junked this beautiful flawless E-copy within walking distance from my house."

definitions.definition: A Chinese sailing vessel.
Of use as a metaphor, simile, or metonym, as opposed to literal; using figures; as when saying that someone who eats more than they should is a pig or like a pig.
Metaphorically so called.
With many figures of speech.
Emblematic, symbolic; representative, exemplative
Representing forms recognisable in life and clearly derived from real object sources, in contrast to abstract art.
To try to get a ride in a passing vehicle while standing at the side of a road, generally by either sticking out one's finger or thumb or holding a sign with one's stated destination.

To be carried along with something else, for example Genetic Hitchhiking where a gene is propagated because it occurs in conjunction with a favourable mutation, or Cultural Hitchhiking where a cultural trait spreads with a technologically advanced population.
The beginning or introductory portion that comes before the main text of a document or book.
definitions.example: The book included a brief preface by a leading expert in the field.

definitions.definition: An introduction, or series of preliminary remarks.
The prelude or introduction to the canon of the Mass.
A title or epithet.
To introduce or make a comment before (the main point).
definitions.example: Let me preface this by saying that I don't know him that well.

definitions.definition: To give a preface to.
definitions.example: to preface a book

definitions.definition: A pictorial graph in the shape of a circle, with segments representing related proportions
In a manner that is incapable of being disputed or argued against.
The inner angle between two sides of a polygon.
A gas or vapour/vapor that is strong-smelling or dangerous to inhale.
definitions.example: Don't stand around in there breathing the fumes while the adhesive cures.

definitions.definition: A material that has been vaporized from the solid or liquid state to the gas state and re-coalesced to the solid state.
definitions.example: Lead fume is a greyish powder, mainly comprising lead sulfate.

definitions.definition: Rage or excitement which deprives the mind of self-control.
definitions.example: the fumes of passion

definitions.definition: Anything unsubstantial or airy; idle conceit; vain imagination.
The incense of praise; inordinate flattery.
A passionate person.
To expose (something) to fumes; specifically, to expose wood, etc., to ammonia in order to produce dark tints.
To apply or offer incense to.
To emit fumes.
To pass off in fumes or vapours.
To express or feel great anger.
definitions.example: He’s still fuming about the argument they had yesterday.

definitions.definition: To be as in a mist; to be dulled and stupefied.
Either rear half of a side of beef, mutton, veal, lamb or by extension from another edible mammal.
(in the plural) The hind biped (leg) of a quadruped, or all body parts situated behind the hind legs' trunk-attachment.
(metonymy, usually plural) Human behind, butt.
Sad; lacking engagement or enthusiasm.
An interval of twelve semitones spanning eight degrees of the diatonic scale, representing a doubling or halving in pitch frequency.
definitions.example: The melody jumps up an octave at the beginning, then later drops back down an octave.

definitions.definition: The pitch an octave higher than a given pitch.
definitions.example: The bass starts on a low E, and the tenor comes in on the octave.

definitions.definition: A coupler on an organ which allows the organist to sound the note an octave above the note of the key pressed (cf sub-octave)
A poetic stanza consisting of eight lines; usually used as one part of a sonnet.
The eighth defensive position, with the sword hand held at waist height, and the tip of the sword out straight at knee level.
The day that is one week after a feast day in the Latin rite of the Catholic Church.
An eight-day period beginning on a feast day in the Latin rite of the Catholic Church.
An octonion.
Any of a number of coherent-noise functions of differing frequency that are added together to form Perlin noise.
The subjective vibration of a planet.
Consisting of eight; eight in number.
A type of trade bloc which is composed of a free trade area with a common external tariff
Something given beyond what is actually due; something added or superfluous.
Something which occurs a fortiori, as a result of another effort without significant additional effort.
definitions.example: Finally getting that cracked window fixed was a nice corollary of redoing the whole storefront.

definitions.definition: A proposition which follows easily from the proof of another proposition.
definitions.example: We have proven that this set is finite and well ordered; as a corollary, we now know that there is an order-preserving map from it to the natural numbers.

definitions.definition: Occurring as a natural consequence or result; attendant; consequential.
Forming a proposition that follows from one already proved.
That which makes smooth; varnish.
To make smooth or glossy; to polish or cause to be attractive.
Having an even, smooth surface; smooth
definitions.example: sleek hair

definitions.definition: Glossy
Not rough or harsh.
Slim and streamlined; not plump, thick, or stocky.
With ease and dexterity.
Spinning or rotary motion given to a ball around the vertical axis, as in billiards or bowling.
definitions.example: You can't hit it directly, but maybe if you give it some english.

definitions.definition: An unusual or unexpected interpretation of a text or idea, a spin, a nuance.
An instance of an out created by touching a base in advance of a runner who has no base to return to while in possession of a ball which has already touched the ground.
definitions.example: A force out was recorded on the scorecard.

definitions.definition: The style of decoration of a room or building.
definitions.example: Her living room had a lush Persian-style decor.

definitions.definition: A stage setting; scenery; set; backdrop.
Rough or unhusked rice, either before it is milled or as a crop to be harvested.
A paddy field, a rice paddy; an irrigated or flooded field where rice is grown.
Low; mean; boorish; vagabond.
A fit of temper; a tantrum
definitions.example: throw a paddy etc.

definitions.definition: A white person.
A labourer's assistant or workmate.
A drill used in boring wells, with cutters that expand on pressure.
Ornamental woodwork either carved in low relief or cut through
Short for ampere.
Short for amplifier.
Short for ampoule.
Short for amputee.
Short for ampicillin.
(usually with up) To amplify.
definitions.example: He asked the disk jockey to amp it up.

definitions.definition: (usually with up) To excite.
(usually with up) To intensify or increase.
definitions.example: 2014, Andy Paul, Amp Up Your Sales, AMACOM Books

definitions.definition: Early morning nausea and vomiting as a symptom of pregnancy.
A four-wheeled cart for hauling loads.
A four-wheeled child's riding toy, pulled or steered by a long handle attached to the front.
An enclosed vehicle for carrying goods or people; (by extension) a lorry, a truck.
An enclosed vehicle used as a movable dwelling; a caravan.
Short for dinner wagon.
Short for paddy wagon.
A freight car on a railway.
Short for station wagon; (by extension) a sport utility vehicle (SUV); any car.
A woman of loose morals, a promiscuous woman, a slapper; (by extension) a woman regarded as obnoxious; a bitch, a cow.
A kind of prefix used in de Bruijn notation.
To load into a wagon in preparation for transportation; to transport by means of a wagon.
To travel in a wagon.
A device designed to condense a gas into a liquid, either as part of a still, steam engine, refrigerator or similar machine.
A capacitor.
A lens (or combination of lenses) designed to gather light and focus it onto a specimen or part of a mechanism.
A dental instrument used to pack filling into a cavity in a tooth.
A row; an argument in which names are called.
Matted material; rough massed hair, fibres etc.
Coarse shredded tobacco.
A type of rough carpet pile.
Bacon or fat, especially if with some remaining hair or bristles.
A roughly-cut or torn-off piece of bread or cheese.
To make hairy or shaggy; to roughen.
To hang in shaggy clusters.
Hairy; shaggy.
Several species of sea birds in the family Phalacrocoracidae (cormorant family), especially the common shag or European shag, Phalacrocorax aristotelis, found on European and African coasts.
A swing dance.
An act of sexual intercourse.
A casual sexual partner.
To shake, wiggle around.
To have sexual intercourse with.
To have sexual intercourse.
To masturbate.
To chase after; especially, to chase after and return (a ball) hit usually out of play.
To perform the dance called the shag.
(Northwestern Ontario) A fundraising dance in honour of a couple engaged to be married.
Friend; mate; buddy.
A current account; a bank account from which money can easily be transferred, by check(US)/cheque(UK) or other means.
A physical fight or struggle.
A conflict, an argument, a disagreement.
To have a tussle.
definitions.example: The two sets of fans were tussling before the game.

definitions.definition: A valve that regulates the supply of fuel-air mixture to an internal combustion engine and thus controls its speed; a similar valve that controls the air supply to an engine.
The lever or pedal that controls this valve.
The windpipe or trachea.
To cut back on the speed of (an engine, person, organization, network connection, etc.).
To strangle or choke someone.
To have the throat obstructed so as to be in danger of suffocation; to choke; to suffocate.
To breathe hard, as when nearly suffocated.
To utter with breaks and interruption, in the manner of a person half suffocated.
A fine, gentle, dispersed mist of liquid.
definitions.example: The sailor could feel the spray from the waves.

definitions.definition: A pressurized container; an atomizer.
Any of numerous commercial products, including paints, cosmetics, and insecticides, that are dispensed from containers in this manner.
A jet of fine medicated vapour, used either as an application to a diseased part or to charge the air of a room with a disinfectant or a deodorizer.
A side channel or branch of the runner of a flask, made to distribute the metal to all parts of the mold.
A group of castings made in the same mold and connected by sprues formed in the runner and its branches.
The allocation and filling of blocks of memory with the same byte sequence, hoping to establish that sequence in a certain predetermined location as part of an exploit.
To project a liquid in a dispersive manner toward something.
definitions.example: The firemen sprayed the house.

definitions.definition: To project in a dispersive manner.
definitions.example: Spray some ointment on that scratch.

definitions.definition: To project many small items dispersively.
To urinate in order to mark territory.
To allocate blocks of memory from (a heap, etc.), and fill them with the same byte sequence, hoping to establish that sequence in a certain predetermined location as part of an exploit.
definitions.example: to spray the heap of a target process

definitions.definition: A small branch of flowers or berries.
definitions.example: The bridesmaid carried a spray of lily-of-the-valley.

definitions.definition: A collective body of small branches.
definitions.example: The tree has a beautiful spray.

definitions.definition: Branches and twigs collectively; foliage.
An orchard.
An ornament or design that resembles a branch.
A tall building, one of many stories.
(of clothing) Designed to sit high on, or above, the wearer's hips.
definitions.example: high-rise jeans

definitions.definition: Someone (especially one who is male) who is skilled in the work of fighting fire.
A person (originally a man) who keeps the fire going underneath a steam boiler (originally, shoveling coal by hand), particularly on a railroad locomotive or steamship.
By extension of the above, an assistant on any locomotive, whether steam-powered or not.
A relief pitcher.
A safety inspector in coal mines.
One of two siblings produced from the splitting of a single zygote.
The smallest animal of a litter.
(by extension) The smallest child in the family.

definitions.definition: Undersized or stunted plant, animal or person.
An Ethernet packet that does not meet the medium's minimum packet size of 64 bytes.
A single word (or portion of a hyphenated word) that appears as the last line of a paragraph.
A breed of pigeon related to the carrier pigeon.
A hardened stem or stalk of a plant.
definitions.example: Neither young poles nor old runts are durable. — Holland.

definitions.definition: A bow.
The science of the dynamics of bodies moving relative to gases, especially the interaction of moving objects with the atmosphere
The aerodynamic properties of a particular object (typically a car)
A small, informal Italian-style restaurant.
To pull off by ripping
To steal, cheat or swindle. Especially to charge an exorbitant or unfair rate
definitions.example: I can't believe how the car dealerships try to rip off their customers.

definitions.definition: To copy, especially illegally
definitions.example: They ripped off the whole idea from their competitors.

definitions.definition: A duct through which an ovum passes from an ovary to the uterus or to the exterior.

A personality disorder indicated by a pattern of lying, exploitation, heedlessness, arrogance, sexual promiscuity, low self-control, and lack of empathy and remorse. Violent and criminal offenses may be indicative of this disorder.
A long straight pin, often with a decorative head, used to secure a woman's hat to her hair.
A wall socket by which electricity is provided to electrical devices.
Overly talkative, insolent, and loud.
A cap that fits the head closely, usually knitted from wool.
definitions.example: Enrique Iglesias is often seen wearing a beanie.

definitions.definition: A head-hugging brimless cap, with or without a visor, made from triangular sections of cloth, leather, or silk joined by a button at the crown and seamed together around the sides.
A Beanie Baby, a small soft toy filled with beans or similar stuffing.
A period of the ecclesiastical year preceding Easter, traditionally involving temporary abstention from certain foods and pleasures.
definitions.example: Hezekiah gave up vaping for Lent.

definitions.definition: The second term of the academic year at some British schools.
To allow to be used by someone temporarily, on condition that it or its equivalent will be returned.
definitions.example: I lent her 10 euros to pay for the train tickets, and she paid me back the next day.

definitions.definition: To make a loan.
To be suitable or applicable, to fit.
definitions.example: Poems do not lend themselves to translation easily.

definitions.definition: To afford; to grant or furnish in general.

definitions.definition: To borrow.
One who works in stone
To make or become grey, as with age.
To cry continuously but not very loudly - especially of a young child.
To whinge or whine.
To fuss or cry
Greyed, old
Grey or partly grey
Streaked or mixed with grey; grizzly; griseous
Misconduct.
A criminal offense.
A debt that is overdue for payment.
One who advises
Diabetes insipidus; any condition characterized by excessive or incontinent urine, now specifically as caused by impaired production of, or response to, the antidiuretic hormone vasopressin.
Any of a group of metabolic diseases whereby a person (or other animal) has high blood sugar due to an inability to produce, or inability to metabolize, sufficient quantities of the hormone insulin.
Any food or beverage with a high amount of sugar.
The combination of online educational materials and interactions with traditional classroom teaching.
